# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/resolution/resolvelib/requirements.py
@source-hash: ec91b867bd9ee589
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:52Z

## Purpose
Concrete implementations of the Requirement interface for pip's dependency resolution system. Provides different requirement types to handle various package specification scenarios in the resolvelib-based resolver.

## Key Classes and Functions

### ExplicitRequirement (L12-48)
Wraps a specific candidate to create a requirement that can only be satisfied by that exact candidate.
- `__init__(candidate)` (L13-14): Stores the target candidate
- `get_candidate_lookup()` (L43-44): Returns the wrapped candidate with no install requirement
- `is_satisfied_by()` (L46-47): Only satisfied by the exact wrapped candidate
- Implements standard equality/hashing based on the wrapped candidate

### SpecifierRequirement (L50-119)
Primary requirement type backed by an InstallRequirement with version specifiers.
- `__init__(ireq)` (L51-56): Validates no direct link, caches normalized extras
- `_equal` property (L58-64): Lazy-loaded string representation for equality comparisons
- `project_name` (L84-87): Canonicalized package name from PEP 508 requirement
- `name` (L89-91): Formatted name including extras using format_name utility
- `format_for_error()` (L93-104): Human-readable comma-separated specifier list
- `get_candidate_lookup()` (L106-107): Returns InstallRequirement for resolution
- `is_satisfied_by()` (L109-119): Validates candidate against version specifiers with prerelease support

### SpecifierWithoutExtrasRequirement (L122-154)
Specialized SpecifierRequirement that strips extras from the underlying InstallRequirement.
- `__init__(ireq)` (L128-133): Uses `install_req_drop_extras()` to remove extras
- Overrides equality/hashing to work with modified InstallRequirement
- Inherits other behavior from SpecifierRequirement

### RequiresPythonRequirement (L156-208)
Handles Python version constraints from package metadata.
- `__init__(specifier, match)` (L159-163): Takes SpecifierSet and matching Python candidate
- `get_candidate_lookup()` (L197-200): Returns candidate only if specifier is satisfied
- `is_satisfied_by()` (L202-207): Validates Python version against specifier
- Uses prerelease-enabled validation like other specifier types

### UnsatisfiableRequirement (L210-245)
Sentinel requirement type for packages that cannot be resolved.
- `__init__(name)` (L213-214): Takes normalized package name
- `get_candidate_lookup()` (L241-242): Always returns None, None
- `is_satisfied_by()` (L244-245): Always returns False
- Used to represent resolution failures in the dependency graph

## Dependencies
- `pip._vendor.packaging`: SpecifierSet, NormalizedName, canonicalize_name for package name handling
- `pip._internal.req`: InstallRequirement and constructor utilities
- `.base`: Requirement interface, Candidate type, CandidateLookup type, format_name utility

## Architecture Notes
- All requirement types implement lazy hashing/equality for performance
- Prerelease handling is delegated to PackageFinder, so these classes always allow prereleases
- String representations are optimized for both debugging (__repr__) and user display (format_for_error)
- Candidate lookup pattern separates explicit candidates from InstallRequirement-based lookups
